intro: Clematoclethra giraldii, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or the evergreen clematis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It prefers acidic, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant green leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers.
